# Typography Tips Best practices for working with text in Vista Graphics. ## Font Selection - Use readable fonts for body text (Arial, Helvetica, Georgia) - Limit font families to 2-3 per design - Consider web-safe fonts or provide fallbacks ## Font Sizing - Use relative sizes for accessibility - Maintain clear hierarchy (title > subtitle > body) - Avoid very small text (below 10px for body) ## Color Contrast - Ensure adequate contrast between text and background - WCAG recommends 4.5:1 ratio for normal text - Test text readability on different backgrounds ## Spacing - Use appropriate line height (1.4-1.6 for body text) - Add space between paragraphs - Consider letter spacing for headings ## Performance - Limit custom web fonts - Preload critical fonts - Use font-display: swap for fallback ## See Also - [Font Settings](/wiki/graphics/text-fonts/font-settings/) - Font reference - [Text Alignment](/wiki/graphics/text-fonts/text-alignment/) - Alignment options
